page.title: 01ASPECTS OF BALLINDALLOCH
page.content: Welcome to Ballindalloch. This a country district in the middle part of Strathspey, partly in Banffshire and partly in Morayshire in the North-east of Scotland, about 70 miles from Aberdeen and 50 miles from Inverness. 25 miles away is the sea at the Moray Firth with its fine sandy beaches. The name Ballindalloch (pronounced Ball in dall/ och ) comes from Gaelic, and one translation gives the meaning as 'settlement of the hillock' while another gives'settlement of the level vale'.Both are true, as Ballindalloch is a beautiful area of hills and valleys. The land within our Domesday Block rises from 130m or 450feet at the lowest point to 370m or 1001 feet at the highest.
